definitions.definition: A disruption , mark or shallow cut on a surface made by scratching.
examples: I can’t believe there is a scratch in the paint already.
Her skin was covered with tiny scratches .

definitions.definition: An act of scratching the skin to alleviate an itch or irritation.
examples: The dog sat up and had a good scratch .

subdefinitions.definition: A starting line (originally and simply, a line scratched in the ground), as in boxing .

A technical error of touching or surpassing the starting mark prior to the official start signal in the sporting events of long jump , discus , hammer throw , shot put , and similar. Originally the starting mark was a scratch on the ground but is now a board or precisely indicated mark.
The last riders to depart in a handicap race .
An aberration . A foul in pool , as where the cue ball is put into a pocket or jumps off the table. ( archaic , US , slang ) A shot which scores by chance and not as intended by the player; a fluke .
A horse withdrawn from a race prior to the start.
examples: There were two scratches in race 8, which reduced the field from nine horses to seven.

definitions.definition: A feed , usually a mixture of a few common grains , given to chickens .
Minute, but tender and troublesome, excoriations , covered with scabs , upon the heels of horses which have been used where it is very wet or muddy.
A genre of Virgin Islander music, better known as fungi .
Scrawled or illegible handwriting; chicken scratch .
Nothing, zero. Used especially in card games or sports, but also expressions like "from scatch".

main_definition: A disruption , mark or shallow cut on a surface made by scratching.

Scrawled or illegible handwriting; chicken scratch .
Nothing, zero. Used especially in card games or sports, but also expressions like "from scatch".
